message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.RO, cs.MM, cs.AI 

This paper deals with the problem of recovering the shape and reflectance of non-Lambertian surfaces using a novel concentric multi-spectral light field (CMSLF) design. This involves computer vision (cs.CV) techniques for depth estimation and reflectance mapping, as well as graphics (cs.GR) for modeling the physical reflectance properties of the surfaces. The use of a multi-camera setup and ring light also involves robotics (cs.RO) and multimedia (cs.MM) aspects. Finally, the paper proposes a physical-based reflectance model that does not rely on any surface prior, which could be considered as an artificial intelligence (cs.AI) approach.
